III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth are placing objects in a sock and using it to break the tile in
the bathroom and then using the pieces to self-harm.
Investigation Consumer Rights Officer was interviewed at the facility on
04/30/2025. He reported there was an incident on 04/26/2025
involving Youth B being upset, then starting to kick the bathroom
walls, break the tiles, then put the broken tiles in a sock and tried
to break the wing door. He said staff provided verbally de-
escalation and removed the tiles. Youth B was not hurt and did not
require medical care. A maintenance request was submitted for
the repairs, but until the repairs can be completed the damaged
tile area has plywood pending the repairs.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 04/30/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for 7 months. Youth A denied being
involved in breaking tiles for self-harm. Youth A reported feeling
safe and did not express any concerns regarding staff supervision.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the facility on 04/30/2025.
Supervisor 1 reported there was an incident in Rose Hall involving
Youth B breaking bathroom tiles and attempting to self-harm.
Supervisor 1 said he did not witness the incident; however, he
heard about the incident and staff were able to de-escalate Youth
B without incident. He said staff were supervising and responded
appropriately.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 05/01/2025, no
additional information was provided.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 05/02/2025. Youth B is
placed on the Hope Wing and has been at the facility for eighteen
months. Youth B admitted that she kicked the bathroom tiles in
attempt to break the tiles and put the broken tiles in a sock. She
said staff were supervising her and tried to remove the broken
tiles, but she put them in her sock and tried to break the window.
2

Staff members took the sock away, but then she tried to self-harm
with the broken tile. Staff made sure to remove all the broken tiles.
Youth B denied being restrained, hurt, or injured. Youth B said she
voluntarily gave the staff all the broken tiles. Youth B said she was
upset but didn’t recall why she was upset and could not recall the
staff members names on the wing that assisted. She said there
were three staff members. Youth B reported she sees her
therapist twice a week. Youth B said she did talk to her therapist
about the self-harming.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 05/02/2025. Youth C is
placed on Hope wing and has been at the facility for seven
months. Youth C reported she witnessed Youth B break the tiles
in the bathroom and put them in a sock, and tried to break the
window, but staff members came (unknown who) came and took
away the tiles. She said there were three staff members on the
wing and staff called for a clear. Youth C reported she sees her
therapist every other day, takes her medication daily, and denied
having any suicidal thoughts.
Therapist was interviewed on 05/02/2025 at the facility. Therapist
reported she has been working with Youth B for over one year.
Youth B is diagnosed with PTSD, ADHD, and depression.
Therapist meets with Youth B twice a week and does daily check-
ins. She said Youth B had a rough week; however, she is stable
and has not harmed herself. Youth B is currently placed on a 1:1
due to threats to self-harm.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/02/2025 at the facility. Staff 1
reported she was assigned to Youth B on 04/26/2025. She said
Youth B was frustrated and agitated because she didn’t get
assigned a specific staff member. Youth B broke the bathroom
tiles, put them in a sock, and tried to break the window. She and
Staff 2 were able to verbally de-escalate Youth B and take away
the sock. She said Youth B said she was going to self-harm,
however she did not self-harm and was not hurt.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 05/14/2025 at the facility. Staff 2
reported he was working on 04/26/2025 on Hope Wing. He said
Youth B was frustrated, went to the bathroom, and kicked the wall.
Youth B picked up the broken bathroom tiles, put them in a sock,
and started hitting the window. A clear was called, and he and
Staff 2 were able to verbally de-escalate Youth B to hand over the
tiles without further incident. He said Youth B did say she was
going to self-harm, however she did not. Youth B was not hurt and
3

did not require medical attention. An incident report was
completed.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 05/14/2025 at the facility.
Supervisor 2 confirmed he was called to assist with the incident on
04/26/2025. He reported a clear was called due to Youth B
breaking the bathroom tiles. Supervisor said Staff 1 and Staff 2
were able to verbally de-escalate Youth B without incident. Youth
B did say she was going to self-harm, however she did not, and
no medical attention was required. An incident report was
completed, and therapist was notified.
Tour of Facility:
A tour of the unit occurred on 05/14/2025, observed hallway that
has bedrooms on each side, leading to the common area. The
hallway had plywood covering some of walls, which Consumer
Officer reported the plywood is used as a temporary fix for
damaged walls. The bathroom was observed to also have
plywood. There were no broken tiles or safety concerns observed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 04/26/2025 written by Staff 2. Report
is consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – To maintain a
safe environment for all Vista Maria clients and staff,
behavior management interventions are only used when a
client presents a danger to self or others. These
interventions should only be used when all other less
restrictive behavior management interventions (i.e., verbal
de-escalation, therapeutic interventions) have been
explored. Vista Maria staff will continuously provide a safe,
supportive, and nurturing environment in which each client
can learn and practice coping and de-escalation
mechanisms that work best for each youth.
• Medical evaluation for Youth B dated 04/28/2025, Youth B
had an abrasion with scab on the sole of her right foot, no
tender, no active bleeding or draining from the area.
• The Facilities maintenance policy, work orders are
submitted electronically that allows employees from any
building or department to identify and communicate
maintenance needs. The system captures basic information
about the request. The pending work order requests are
reviewed by the Maintenance Supervisor, prioritized and
assigned.
4

• Facility’s suicide prevention policy: Vista Maria takes any
threat of suicide seriously and will take all steps necessary
to prevent suicide among our clients. In the event of a
suicide threat and/or attempt, the shift supervisor must
seek immediate medical attention for the client, if
necessary. If immediate medical attention is not necessary,
and if the client cannot be controlled, the client must be
placed on confinement status. Observation. If confinement
status is not necessary, the client must be placed on
observation status with at least 15-minute-interval
documentation as deemed appropriate by the
therapist/psychiatrist or building manager. If placed on
100% observation, this will include a
staff to accompany the client throughout the entire shift.
The client’s bedroom will be cleaned out of all personal
items for safety and the client will remain in her bedroom
with the staff to monitor activity and behaviors.
• Youth B’s safety plan updated on 05/01/2025: The goal of
the plan is to help Youth B manage unsafe behaviors
including self-harmful behavior, suicidal ideation,
aggression, property destruction, and impulsivity. Youth B
is being placed on 1:1 observation status for behavior
monitoring and self-harm from the hours of 7a-9:15p
daily. Youth B observation status is: 1:1 observation for
behavior monitoring and self-harm from the hours of 7a-
9:15p daily. Youth B will participate in the full treatment
milieu programming
• Vista Maria Supervision policy notes youth on all units are
to be continually supervised, and the shift supervisor is
responsible for supervising youth and floor staff on the unit
and must be able to account for them. One staff (this may
be the supervisor or team lead) must be free to carry out
the following tasks: periodically walk around the building,
complete a security check, account for all clients, and
assist in a crisis or in moving clients, if needed.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews with staff,
youths, and documentation reviewed, staff provided appropriate
supervision with Youth B during an escalated incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
